intro: Hedyotis effusa, commonly known as small white geranium, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many flowering plants known for their ornamental and medicinal value. The plant features opposite, linear leaves and produces small, white or pale pink flowers with five petals. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or stream banks. Hedyotis effusa is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial properties.
